look: It's a brass key. You get the feeling that it's only useful in the tutorial. It definitely opens a locked door or two.
It's a regular old banana. It has a pleasing yellow color.
It's a belt. Like, not the kind you wear, the kind that connect pulleys together. You know, the mechanical kind of belt.

args: It's a small, smooth stone. You feel the urge to throw it for some reason.
It's a small, smooth stone. You feel the urge to throw it for some reason--but not here.
You really don't see the point of throwing the stone right now.

look: It's a cylindrical metal rod about an inch and a half in diameter. It's rusty but still sturdy. It has a grip at one end. Maybe it's a handle of some kind.
It's rusty but should still do its job well enough.
It's a gardening trowel--a little rusty but should still be fine.
It's a plain, wooden bucket with a handle. You assume it will be useful at some point.
The strip of red fabric is faded and tattered.
They're a pair of scissors. They're the size you would expect except they're made of clear glass.
It's a whitish color and throbs and shakes. It holds life within. Horrible, horrible life.
It's a small glass vial with a cork stopper. The liquid within shimmers.
It's a heavy duty metal flashlight. There's a button on it that toggles it on and off. You could "use flashlight" to toggle the switch back and forth.

args: You flick the switch on your flashlight, turning it off.
You flick the switch on your flashlight, turning it on.

look: It's pretty heavy but could do a lot of damage.

It is the off-white color of bone. It's a rough sphere, about a foot in diameter but it's surface isn't smooth. Instead, it's covered in multitudinous little white spikes all over. It's got an umbilical-like stem that is a bone-white color with blue veins just beneath the surface.
You don't know how you know this, but the rune represents the deisigh charm.
It's a glass bottle with a cork stopper. It has red liquid inside and a label that reads "potion of healing".

use: Now's not the time. You might need it later.
